com.github.mikephil.charting.utils

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mikephil.charting.utils.Utils

  • public abstract class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities class that has some helper methods. Needs to be initialized by calling Utils.init(...) before usage. Inside the Chart.init() method, this is done, if the Utils are used before that, Utils.init(...) needs to be called manually.

      • convertDpToPixel

        public static float convertDpToPixel(float dp)
        This method converts dp unit to equivalent pixels, depending on device density. NEEDS UTILS TO BE INITIALIZED BEFORE USAGE.
        Parameters:
        dp - A value in dp (density independent pixels) unit. Which we need to convert into pixels
        Returns:
        A float value to represent px equivalent to dp depending on device density

      • convertPixelsToDp

        public static float convertPixelsToDp(float px)
        This method converts device specific pixels to density independent pixels. NEEDS UTILS TO BE INITIALIZED BEFORE USAGE.
        Parameters:
        px - A value in px (pixels) unit. Which we need to convert into db
        Returns:
        A float value to represent dp equivalent to px value

      • formatNumber

        public static java.lang.String formatNumber(float number,
                            int digitCount,
                            boolean separateThousands)
        Formats the given number to the given number of decimals, and returns the number as a string, maximum 35 characters. If thousands are separated, the separating character is a dot (".").
        Parameters:
        number -
        digitCount -
        separateThousands - set this to true to separate thousands values
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        digitCount -
        separateThousands - set this to true to separate thousands values
        separateChar - a caracter to be paced between the "thousands"

      • getClosestDataSetIndex

        public static int getClosestDataSetIndex(java.util.List<SelectionDetail> valsAtIndex,
                         float val,
                         YAxis.AxisDependency axis)
        Returns the index of the DataSet that contains the closest value on the y-axis. This is needed for highlighting. This will return -Integer.MAX_VALUE if failure.
        Parameters:
        valsAtIndex - all the values at a specific index
        Returns:
